catFacts: A cat's nose is as unique as a human's fingerprint.
Cats sleep for 70% of their lives.
A group of cats is called a clowder.
Cats can rotate their ears 180 degrees.
birdFacts: Penguins can jump up to 6 feet in the air.
Owls can rotate their heads almost 270 degrees.
The hummingbird is the only bird that can fly backwards.
Some birds, like pigeons, can detect Earth's magnetic fields to navigate.
videoGameFacts: The first video game ever created was called 'Tennis for Two' in 1958.
The longest gaming session lasted more than 35 hours, according to the Guinness World Records.
In 'Minecraft,' there's a 1 in 10,000 chance for the title screen to display a typo in the logo.
The best-selling video game of all time is 'Minecraft,' with over 238 million copies sold.
humanFacts: The human body contains enough fat to make seven bars of soap.
Your heart beats about 100,000 times a day.
The human nose can detect about 1 trillion smells.
Humans are the only species known to blush.
